participant_1.name: Olivia
participant_1.personality: Empathetic and nurturing, Olivia is dedicated to her work and values meaningful connections.
participant_1.background: I am proud of my family's history and culture. I am a special ed teacher. I love to start my day with some quiet time to myself. I don’t trust anyone. I read a lot and spend my time on community activities.

participant_2.name: Ethan
participant_2.personality: Analytical and creative, Ethan enjoys tackling challenges and appreciates the beauty of diverse experiences.
participant_2.background: I am a software engineer who works remotely, so I can live in a big city and still take care of my parents in my hometown. I work as an electrician. I loved spending summers in the country with my cousins and pets. I used to enjoy playing sports, but my back pain has made it too difficult. I loved reading books as a child, and I would often spend hours in my room, lost in a world of my imagination.

content.text: What's up? I'm a special ed teacher. How are you?
I'm good! I'm an electrician. I get to work in different places all the time, which is fun. What do you like about being a special ed teacher?
I love working with kids and helping them learn. I also love reading books to them. What do you like about being an electrician?
I like the challenge of working on different projects and coming up with solutions to problems. I also like the variety of work that I get to do. What kind of books do you like to read?
I like to read all kinds of books, but I especially like historical fiction. I also like to read books about science and nature. What kind of books do you like to read?
I like to read science fiction and fantasy books. I also like to read books about history and philosophy. What are your favorite books?
My favorite book is To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee. I also love the Harry Potter series by J.K. Rowling. What are your favorite books?
My favorite book is The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy by Douglas Adams. I also love the Lord of the Rings series by J.R.R. Tolkien.
Those are both great books! I've read them both multiple times
